verses.verse: Where do fights and quarrels among you [come] from? [Don't they come] from your sensual desires that at war in your bodies.
You set your heart on something and do not get [it], so you commit murder. You zealously desire but cannot obtain it, so you quarrel and fight. You do not get things, because you do not ask.
You ask, and do not receive, because you ask with wicked motives, in order to squander it on your sensual pleasures.
You adulterers and adulteresses, don't you know that to be a friend of the world is to be an enemy of God?
Or do you think that the Scripture says for no reason, "The spirit that lives in us lusts because of envy?"
But He gives greater grace. That's why he says, "God resists the proud but gives grace to the humble."
Therefore, submit yourselves to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
Draw near to God, and He will draw near to you. Cleanse [your] hands, sinners, and purify [your] hearts, double minded.
Be in agony, moan, and wail. Let you laughter turn into sobbing and [your] joy into heartbreak.
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will lift you up.
Do not badmouth one another, brothers. He, who badmouths and condemns his brother, condemns the law, but if you condemn the law, you are not a doer, but its judge.
There is only one lawgiver, who is able to save and destroy. So who are you to condemn another?
Come on, you who say, "Today or tomorrow we will go into this city, stay there a year, buy and sell, and make money."
On the contrary, you don't even know what [will happen] tomorrow. For what [is] your life? It is just a puff of smoke that appears for a moment then disappears.
For you should say, "If the Lord wants us to, then we will live and do this or that."
But now you rejoice in your self-confidence; all such rejoicing is evil.
So then, the one, who knows what is right and does not do it, is guilty of sin.
